pr_title: MINOR: Replace ApiVersion by auto-generated protocol

timeline.bodyText: Should we rename the generated class to have a more concise name? It seems unnecessarily verbose.
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: How about renaming ApiVersionsResponseKey to ApiVersion?
replies.author: chia7712

replies.bodyText: Using ApiVersion sounds reasonable to me.
replies.author: dajac

replies.bodyText: Sounds good if there are no name conflicts as a result of that change.
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: I have renamed it in the latest commit.
replies.author: chia7712

timeline.message: MINOR: Replace ApiVersion by auto-generated protocol
MINOR: Replace ApiVersion by auto-generated protocol
MINOR: Replace ApiVersion by auto-generated protocol

timeline.bodyText: Can we import ApiVersion directly? I don't think ApiVersionsResponseData adds any value here and other similar places.
timeline.author: ijuma

timeline.bodyText: It would be good to have a helper method somewhere that converts ApiKeys to ApiVersion.
timeline.author: ijuma

timeline.bodyText: It's a bit weird that we only check if other is null. Do we need this check at all?
timeline.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText: From the usage of this method, only other can be null. So current check is enough.
replies.author: chia7712

replies.bodyText: That's not a good way to design apis, right? This kind of thing should be symmetric. Why is other sometimes null?
replies.author: ijuma

replies.bodyText:
Why is other sometimes null?

The api key is supported by client-side but Controller doesn't.

That's not a good way to design apis, right? This kind of thing should be symmetric.

make sense. will address it and add unit tests.
replies.author: chia7712

timeline.bodyText: We can use the helper that converts from ApiKey to ApiVersion here too.
timeline.author: ijuma
